docs.lead_paragraph: Politicians and even some technologists say Silicon Valley’s efforts to crack down on the use of social media and other technologies like encryption by terrorists have been toothless.

byline.contributor: Nicole Perlroth reported from San Francisco and Mike Isaac from New York. Cecilia Kang and Michael S. Schmidt contributed reporting from Washington.
byline.original: By NICOLE PERLROTH and MIKE ISAAC

docs.snippet: Politicians and even some technologists say Silicon Valley’s efforts to crack down on the use of social media and other technologies like encryption by terrorists have been toothless....
docs.abstract: Politicians and some technology experts say Silicon Valley's attempts to diminish or stop terrorists' use of social media and use of encryption technologies are ineffectual; example of pro-Islamic State group calling itself Asawitiri Media, which created 335 Twitter accounts when Twitter attempted to cut off authors of account, highlighted.

headline.main: Terrorists Mock Bids to End Use of Social Media

docs.snippet: Donald J. Trump’s call to bar Muslims from entering the United States has drawn swift condemnation from his Republican rivals for the nomination, raising the question of whether the billionaire businessman has finally gone too far....

headline.main: Donald Trump’s Republican Rivals Condemn His Call to Bar Muslims From Entering U.S.
